hjb.http
Class HJBServlet

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          hjb.http.HJBServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig
public class HJBServlet
extends HttpServlet

HJBServlet accepts requests and translates them into JMSCommands that manipulate HJB's configured JMS resources.

The methods doDelete(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse), doGet(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) and doPost(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) are overridden so that the HttpServlet.service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse) method maps recognized HJB URLs to the correct JMSCommands.

Author:
Tim Emiola
See Also:

handleUsingMatchingGenerator

protected void handleUsingMatchingGenerator(JMSCommandGenerator[] generators,
                                            HttpServletRequest request,
                                            HttpServletResponse response)
                                     throws ServletException,
                                            IOException
Scans through generators and uses the first matching one to process the request.

Parameters:
generators - some JMSCommandGenerators
request - a HttpServletRequest
response - a HttpResponse
Throws:
ServletException - if there is a problem accessing the servlets HJBRoot
IOException - if a problem occurs while writing the response

handleUsingSelectedGenerator

protected void handleUsingSelectedGenerator(JMSCommandGenerator generator,
                                            HttpServletRequest request,
                                            HttpServletResponse response)
                                     throws ServletException,
                                            IOException
Uses generator to generate a command, execute it, then send the appropriate response.

The following steps occur:

  • The command and its assigned command runner are generated by the generator
  • The command is scheduled to execute on the command runner
  • The method blocks until the command is executed, or the timeout occurs, (the timeout period is a servlet configuration parameter)
  • When execution is complete, a response is sent using JMSCommandGenerator.sendResponse(HttpServletResponse)

Parameters:
generator - the selected JMSCommandGenerator
request - a HttpServletRequest
response - a HttpResponse
Throws:
ServletException - if there is a problem accessing the servlets HJBRoot
IOException - if a problem occurs while writing the response
